definition: (of speech or actions) direct and efficient/without fooling around
tree trunk/main part of sth/to manage/to work/to do/capable/cadre/to kill (slang)/to fuck (vulgar)
to fall or drop/(of the sun) to set/(of a tide) to go out/to lower/to decline or sink/to lag or fall behind/to fall onto/to rest with/to get or receive/to write down/whereabouts/settlement
colloquial reading for 落[luo4] in certain compounds
to leave out/to be missing/to leave behind or forget to bring/to lag or fall behind

sentences.english: He has an incisive manner of speaking, happily free from umms and ers.
sentences.chinese: 他说话干脆利落，完全没有哼哼哈哈的腔调。

sentences.english: I struck the ball cleanly and my shot was on target.
sentences.chinese: 我干脆利落地击球，命中了目标。

sentences.english: It has a crisp visual impact.
sentences.chinese: 它是一个干脆利落的视觉冲击。

sentences.english: Her voice was crisp and authoritative.
sentences.chinese: 她的声音干脆利落，具有权威性。

definition: see 乾脆利落|干脆利落[gan1 cui4 li4 luo5]
lit. wading in mud and water/a slovenly job/sloppy
to do something at one go/to flow smoothly
see 直截了當|直截了当[zhi2 jie2 liao3 dang4]
lit. moving clouds and flowing water (idiom)/fig. very natural and flowing style of calligraphy, writing, etc/natural and unforced
delighted/to one's heart's content/straightforward/also pr. [tong4 kuai5]
lit. to chop the nail and slice the iron (idiom)/fig. resolute and decisive/unhesitating/categorical
going directly (without detour)/(fig.) direct/straightforward (in one's manner or speech)
to sever all relations with sb/determined/decisive
